items.title: Polymer 2.0
items.description:
Polymer 2.0 is build around the shadow DOM 1.0 specification. This allows its framework to leverage native Web Components in edge browsers.

https://www.polymer-project.org/2.0/docs/about_20

items.title: AngularJS
items.description: AngularJS or Angular 1.0 has seen strong adoption due to its innovation in javascript development [angularJS](https://angularjs.org/) but it is advised to move forward with Angular 2.

items.title: Angular 2
items.description:
A long awaited major release to [AngularJS](https://angular.io/). Angular has taken a different route compared to React, where both framework compete each other. 

https://angular.io/

items.title: Vue.js
items.description: A strong competitor to React is [Vue.js](https://vuejs.org/). Both demand the latest javascript spec for development and all its advantages. Vue promotes itself to test better in [performance](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/comparison.html).

items.title: React
items.description: Taking the lead in modern modular frameworks [React](https://facebook.github.io/react/) has created a very strong following, and an innovative standard for (frontend) web development.
